title: Export data cleaning
text: This report explores an export data file for the Fan District Association looking for data inconsistencies and overall metrics.

title: Export data cleaning
text:
Overall summary of records

metrics.summary()

Excel File: ../data/2025-02-17 Contacts Fan District Association.xls
Number of records: 1235
Number of unique User IDs: 1235
Number of unique, non-blank emails: 1161
Number of unique, non-blank Usernames: 1039
Number of unique, non-blank Member bundle ID or emails: 893

title: Export data cleaning
text:
User IDs by level
Only records marked with Membership enabled = yes are included in the list.

metrics.count_membership_by_level()

Membership level
Friend                                            29
Household                                        689
Household - Autorenewing Annually                235
Individual                                       162
Individual - Autorenewing Annually                39
Organization/Business                             26
Organization/Business - Autorenewing Annually      9
Student                                            6
Name: User ID, dtype: int64

title: Export data cleaning
text:
Bundles by level
A bundle is a group of user ids that share a single membership.

metrics.count_bundles_by_level()

Membership level
Friend                                            29
Household                                        427
Household - Autorenewing Annually                155
Individual                                       162
Individual - Autorenewing Annually                39
Organization/Business                             26
Organization/Business - Autorenewing Annually      9
Student                                            6
Name: Member bundle ID or email, dtype: int64

title: Export data cleaning
text:
Duplicate Emails
Below is a list of user ID with duplicate emails. This list is most probably clean.

metrics.get_users_with_duplicate_emails()

title: Neighborhood Shapefile
text: Display the neighborhood shapefile obtained from the Richmond Geohub.

title: Neighborhood Shapefile
text:
Shapefile plot
Below is a plot of the boundaries in the shape file. No formatting or cleaning is being done. Later, one can pretty-up the plot by removing axes, adding shape titles or names, etc.

#import os
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from fandu.geo_utils import load_shapefile_from_zip

gdf = load_shapefile_from_zip( zip_path="../data/Neighborhoods-shp.zip")

fig, ax = plt.subplots( figsize=(10, 6) )
gdf.plot(ax=ax, edgecolor="black", facecolor="lightgray")

title: Neighborhood Shapefile
text:
Shapefile data
The table below lists the regions in the shape file.

from tabulate import tabulate
from IPython.display import Markdown

# Display available columns 
#print("Available columns:", gdf.columns)  

# Select relevant columns
columns = ["ID", "Name", "District", "Class"]
table_data = gdf[columns].values.tolist()

# Generate a Markdown table
Markdown(tabulate(table_data, headers=columns ) )

title: Welcome!
text:
Neighborhoods in Richmond - A quick report exploring the GIS shapefile from City of Richmond containing a listing of neighborhoods in the City. The boundary for The Fan can be pulled from here and used to find addresses and parcels located within The fan.
Sample Dashboard - A quick dashboard highlighting some of the dashboard features built into Quarto.

The top left panel contains a leaflet map of the fan. One can zoom in and out and pan around to explore the city or world.
The top right panel contains a display of the neighborhood shapefile downloaded from City of Richmond. Look at the report above for more details.
the cards across the bottom contain dummy data and in the code present different ways to create cards.

title: Welcome!
text:
Neighborhoods in Richmond - A quick report exploring the GIS shapefile from City of Richmond containing a listing of neighborhoods in the City. The boundary for The Fan can be pulled from here and used to find addresses and parcels located within The fan.
Sample Dashboard - A quick dashboard highlighting some of the dashboard features built into Quarto.

The top left panel contains a leaflet map of the fan. One can zoom in and out and pan around to explore the city or world.
The top right panel contains a display of the neighborhood shapefile downloaded from City of Richmond. Look at the report above for more details.
the cards across the bottom contain dummy data and in the code present different ways to create cards.
